title: Sirens
lyrics:
Do you remember the night the AC burned out?
It was like a hundred degrees
And we laid on the couch reading old magazines
Warm pages left ink on our finger tips
You pressed a handprint on the wall in my apartment

I think I’m gonna paint over it



After all

Why’d you call?

After all

Why’d you call?



Who turned on the sirens?

These tears won’t put your fire out, no

Who’s side are you on?

Why’d you come here if you were just gonna leave, oh



What’s this game that you’re playing?

All you’ve taken

Did it mean nothing to you?

Why are you so cruel?



Do remember the night all of the lights went out

And you threw half of my records in your car

You said, “Don’t try to call me”

That’s fine, that’s not what made this hurt so hard



Look, I’m just tryna understand why you came back now

I think you owe me that this time

Are you satisfied?



After all

Why’d you call?

After all

Why’d you call?



Who turned on the sirens?

These tears won’t put your fire out, no

Who’s side are you on?

Why’d you come here if you were just gonna leave, oh



What’s this game that you’re playing?

All you’ve taken

Did it mean nothing to you?

Why are you so cruel?



After all

Why’d you call?

(Why’d you call, why’d you call, why’d you call, why’d you call, why’d you call?)

After all

Why’d you call?



Do you remember the night the AC burned out?

It was like a hundred degrees

And we laid on the couch reading old magazines



Warm pages left ink on our finger tips

You pressed a handprint on the wall in my apartment

I think I’m gonna paint over it
